citation.article-title: Reclassification of Promicromonospora pachnodae Cazemier et al. 2004 as Xylanimicrobium pachnodae gen. nov., comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Xylanimicrobium (Xy.la.ni.mi.cro′bi.um. N.L. neut. n. xylan xylan a polysaccharide; Gr. adj. mikros small; Gr. masc. n. bios life; N.L. neut. n. Xylanimicrobium xylan-hydrolysing microbe).
The description is based on the original description of the species Promicromonospora pachnodae DSM 12657T and data from Cazemier et al. (2003) and our own data.
Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, irregular rod-shaped cells, non-motile, occurring singly or in pairs.

The murein contains the amino acids lysine, glutamic acid and serine (d-lys–l-ser–d-Glu), belonging to the peptidoglycan type A4α, variation A11.48. N-glycolylmuramic acid, mycolic acids and hydroxy fatty acids are absent.
Whole cell sugars are rhamnose, galactose and glucose.
Phospholipids are phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol and three unknown phospholipids.
Xylanolytic; facultative anaerobic, acid is produced from some carbohydrates.
Phylogenetically related to Xylanimonas cellulosilytica, Xylanibacterium ulmi and I. variabilis.
The type species is Xylanimicrobium pachnodae (Cazemier et al. 2004).
